page.title: 14Monsal Dale Walk.
page.content: On the 24th of July 1985, I went, along with about sixty other children, on our end of term event; a walk through Monsal Dale in Derbyshire. At nine o'clock in the morning we got on the coach which was to take us the twenty miles to Ashford-in-the-Water where the walk started. We walked for four or five miles along the wooded valley of the river Wye and then about midday we stopped to eat our packed lunches. Afterwards we walked on for another mile or two and then stopped to have a paddle in the cool waters of the river. Quite a loy of the children fell over and got extremely wet. After everybody had got dry we had a walk up a very steep hill at the top of which was a stall where you could buy souveniers and then we went home. I thought it was very enjoyable but I don't fancy doing it
